alert.note: Alert for Eastern Douglas County Foothills; South Central Oregon Cascades (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 19 at 9:36AM PST until February 22 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 10 inches over populated or traveled regions, but 10 to 20 inches over the mountains. Winds could gust as high as 50 mph, especially over exposed terrain. * WHERE...Eastern Douglas County Foothills, South Central Oregon Cascades and Siskiyou Mountains and Southern Oregon Cascades. This includes much of highway 138, Diamond Lake Junction on highway 230, highway 62 and higher potions of highway 138. * WHEN...From late Monday night through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. The cold wind chills as low as 5 below zero could result in hypothermia if precautions are not taken. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snowfall rates could reach 1 inch per hour at times Tuesday. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Stock emergency kit with tire chains, flashlight, batteries, blankets, food, water, and medications. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * Plan now to avoid traveling during the storm. * A Winter Storm Watch means there is potential for significant snow accumulations that may create dangerous travel.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Douglas County Foothills; South Central Oregon Cascades
